This merciless killer delivers 3 Death attacks with a high DC in the first flurry when attacking from stealth, then HIPSes away to rinse and repeat.
He gets 7 attacks per round when dual-wielding Kamas, 8 with Flurry of blows and 9 once you can cast Haste.
He has an undispellable Improved invisibility that secures 50% concealment. Add Epic dodge and a high AC for a very strong defence against physical attacks (if he is ever spotted).
He is fast: 130% of normal speed. If you have Haste items or can cast the spells Expeditious retreat or Mass haste, you become super fast! If you stack the spells, you can virtually move with DM speed.
He has Stunning fist with a DC of 32 as a back-up plan to stun creatures that are immune to the DA paralysis. Hasted and with Flurry of blows active he has 7 attacks per round when unarmed for 3 Stunning fist attempts with his first blow.
He will detect deadly traps immediately and can recover and set all deadly traps.
All locks with a DC of 35 or lower can be opened.

UMD comes a bit late. I have given the trap skills priority, but that can be rearranged to your taste.
Since he is a dexer, he is a bit slow to level before he gets DA and HIPS, but after that you can rush through the levels, if you want.
Like all stealth characters he is at a disadvantage against creatures with True seeing, eg Dragons.
Against undead and other creatures immune to sneak/death attacks, adding damage to your weapons will compensate some for your loss af DA damage. Try GMW and Flame weapon.

The search engine shows that this level spread has been tried before:
Shadow Karma monk 9 / assassin 26 / shadowdancer 5 (human) by Feledrae
Monk 9 / shadowdancer 5 / assassin 26 (halfling) by Cow Art
The Drow Assassin monk 9 / shadowdancer 5 / assassin 26 (elf) by lendorallen
Drow Ninja monk 9 / shadowdancer 5 / assassin 26 (elf) by fernandooa

They have all lower dex and AB and a different skill selection. Some have different focus like SCV and ISA (still bugged with DA alone).

posts.author: HipRedux

NP, Stagmeister.  Perhaps you should download the Grimoire (it's been lodged among many standard resources on the Neverwinter Vault's University compendium) for those rare occasions when the Web isn't cooperating.  It's not as accurate as the wiki, but can be a handy alternate resource of general information under special situations like the one you encountered.

Without trying to induce another tedious round of the Spot vs. Listen debate...

...the main thing to remember is that all classes are at a severe disadvantage without at least one of the detection skills. Users of True Seeing, either via their spell repertoire or by UMD scroll-reading, are still open to stealth attacks that are not within their line-of-sight, like around any obstructions or corners.  That's what typically makes Listen the superior detection skill over Spot.  The caveat is, though, that in order to hear them, they must be in motion for the Move Silently vs. Listen check to evaluate.  And that's the other side of the equation in support of the usefulness of Spot over Listen for those classes not privy to the advantages of a True Seeing buff.  Some detection is always important and has significant consequences when omitted from a skill set.

One example of Spot's best advantage is against a HiPSer.  An SD will try to toggle stealth right in front of your toon and the effectiveness depends solely on the opposed Spot skill.  But this is mainly a PvP consideration.

Thorsson wrote: Hi

I'm very rusty on NWN, but what does this build do against crit immunes?
Crit immunity alone would not pose a problem for this build. But creatures with crit immunity do normally also have sneak immunity.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
It is definitely possible to build a Monk 10/ BG 25/ SD 5 like you suggest. But building with BG is a completely different build!
25 Levels of BG will give 8d6 SA. You need 8d6 SA to qualify for ISA, so there will not be any room for ISA in the build.
A BG heavy build has a better BAB and more attacks, exactly like you said (The Kama-Shinobi has 7 attacks per round unbuffed). Bg also has all the BG proficiencies and features, including a Bull's that stacks with spells and potions.

Assassin grants far more class skills and more skill points than BG. I have used skills extensively in my build. Assassin also has great Dexterity as an epic bonus feat that enables a higher AB and AC. In that respect it is even better than rogue here.
The Kama-Shinobi is a stalker. You attack unprepared and flat-footed targets from stealth:
42d6 damage and forcing the target to save 3 times against a DA DC of 38 (44 with full buffs) in a single flurry of attacks is no laughing matter - and is what makes this build lethal.
HIPS even let you "rinse and repeat".

The Kama Shinobi is better when he can attack from stealth and paralyze his targets, but he also has the means to handle true seers.
He gets 7 attacks per round when dual-wielding Kamas, 8 with Flurry of blows and 9 once you can cast Haste. A high AB helps land all those attacks, and is especially important since he dual wields his weapons. He has Improved KD and deals full DA damage when the targets are prone. The shere number of attacks will also add up to a considerable damage, even if you are unable to deal DA damage. The unarmed AB is 39, which is what you expect from a strong monk build.

The defence is very good even without AS. The naked and mundane AC is 34. Add enhanced armor/natural/deflection/dodge AC to this and add +6 AC from max dexterity bonus  and +6 AC from maxed wisdom bonus. If the Shield spell is modified to give shield AC, you can also add that.
He has an undispellable Improved invisibility that secures 50% concealment, with a 50% miss chance. This makes the SC feats unnecessary.
Epic dodge cancels the first successful attack made against him in each round, (or the first attack of opportunity).
He is fast: 130% of normal speed. If you have Haste items or can cast the spells Expeditious retreat or Mass haste, you become super fast! If you stack the spells, you can virtually move with DM speed.
This secures a very quick approach for attack, sometimes even before the NPC target has time to react (fires his "on perception" script). It also secures a very quick retreat, if need be.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
The Maker -
The demi lich is a 'skeleton' so non bludgeon weapons are halved in damage. Being undead is immune to sneak attacks and critical hits. Almost impossible to kill with straight non-bludgeon weapon, even if +10. Is effectively immune to any elemental damage. Divine damage and Magic damage work pretty good. If you are a cleric/druid, it is easy in many ways, you were designed for this battle. If you can find a weapon with divine damage, great. Even with bludgeon damage, has +20 soak 10 damage reduction, so a two handed bludgeon weapon works best to max up your strength bonus.

He has +20 soak 10 damage (which means you can't overcome his damage reduction), he's immune to cold and electrical damage and has 20/-resistance to fire, acid and sonic damage. He's also 50% immune to piercing and slashing. Plus, he has a SR of 32. On top of all that, his AC is 44.
IF you can get Divine and/or Magic damage on your kamas, you should be able to chip him to death with them.  Other than that...good luck!

posts.content:
Vs the Maker Gloves (in general) are better than Kamas because they are blunt. But with only 8 or 9 monk levels, your fists are far from at their max damage. 
Any magical or divine damage on your Kamas/ Gloves will hurt him. 
Casting spells from items with UMD will probably not beat the SR. I'm not sure if Mord's or or the Breach spells will be able to lower his SR.
If you manage to lay traps, holy traps will deal divine damage.
Some people claim that they have been able to take him down by throwing multiple flasks of Holy water at him.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
I'm not sure if Mord's or or the Breach spells will be able to lower his SR.
They will.
Breach spells strip an enemy mage of magical defenses. Lesser spell breach strips two spells, greater spell breach strips four spells, and Mordenkainen's disjunction strips six spells. In addition, a breach will lower spell resistance for ten rounds, excluding resistance from diamond soul.
Depending on which Breach one uses, the SR is lowered respectively.  With an SR of 32 (highest toolset DR, btw), even a Mords will only lower it by 10 i.e. to 22.  Nature's Balance could potentially lower it more, depending on the Caster level of it.  Note there is a Will save.  Not sure exactly what it is against, however.
